title: Project Support Manager Interview
Interview Descriptions: standard and friendly not too formal. first interview with a recruiter and second one with a panel and then final interview with the recruiter who told me I was selected for the position and then communicated the benefits package and offer through email
Interview Questions: stabdard interview question about experience and responsibilities

title: Security Officer Interview
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was not objective. The interviewees were not objective and the HR was very rude she asked me very irrelevant questions. Also the job offered was done in a hurried manner with no proper engagement and time to consult
Interview Questions: How old are you today? When can star

title: Senior Director, Communications Interview
Interview Descriptions: The first step was to apply online via a portal. I was asked to come in for an in-person interview to meet with three people from separate departments. The second interview consisted of a presentation on strategy prepared by me for the organization and another panel.
Interview Questions: What would you recommend for our communications strategy?

title: Chief of Party Interview
Interview Descriptions: It happened in 3 rounds and it was magical, like in a movie. I was just so happy to take an interview with them, it was just a blast and you need to try too

title: Senior Program Officer Interview
Interview Descriptions: Short phone screen with a recruiter followed by an in-person interview partially in person and partially over Skype. Received several emails saying they were interviewing other candidates and would get back followed by nothing from the recruiter, no follow-up and no response to my inquiries. First job application process where I have ever been "ghosted."
Interview Questions: Basic background questions, experience in international development

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Counterpart International (Arlington, VA)
Interview Descriptions: Received HR call to schedule interview after a call from the program manager.. Then had in person interview followed by written test.. The whole process took around a month
Interview Questions: How did you hear about the job?

title: Senior Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Counterpart International
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screening followed by an in-person interview. A second in-person is required before the final decision. However, I didn't make it to this point in the process.

The interviewers were personable and made the conversation fun. My main issue is that I was promised follow-up from HR - regardless of outcome - that never came. This is one of my ultimate pet peeves. If I hadn't emailed to check on the status of my application (two weeks after the interview) I wouldn't have heard anything at all. Follow-up was promised within 3 days of the initial in-person.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with USAID rules and regulations?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Counterpart International
Interview Descriptions: very straight forwards interview, all questions you would expect a hiring manager to ask. They asked about school, job experience.  They basically just wanted to get to know the interviewee

title: Business Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Counterpart International (Washington, DC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a screening interview with a recruiter, a written test, and another interview with the development team. I then was told I was moving forward with a second interview with management and to prepare a 15 minute presentation about a hypothetical project. However, despite being told I would be contacted the following week to set up a time to present, they never contacted me again.  I emailed all the contacts I had been given (three by that point) several weeks later, and no one bothered to even return the emails. I could not believe how unprofessional and inconsiderate this hiring team was, and would absolutely never work for this organization or recommend that someone waste their time interviewing with them.
Interview Questions: What grant applications have you worked on?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Counterpart International
Interview Descriptions: I first interviewed with the HR person in the field and then the COP. Both interviews went really well. Then I had a phone interview with the home office, which I also thought went well. I sent thank-you emails every time, followed up with the home office, and never heard back from them. Not even a form letter saying "thanks for your interest; we decided to go with someone else."
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness? Why do you want this job?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Counterpart International in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Negative experince,  bulish discussion, all with the end agenda to make me lower my salary expectations. 

Off course I decline there offers. 

A place to be avoided in the future! 

Lack of seriousness in there preparation for the interview,  no previous background checks not even an eye drop on my CV and qualifications. 
Only one terrible issue : my wage demands!
Interview Questions: Why I have such high salary expectations?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Counterpart International (Arlington, VA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received invite for an interview 2 weeks later. Due to schedules interview was scheduled much later. Very flexible and offered to do a Skype interview since I wasn't living in the area (although I was willing to travel for the interview). Asked general/predictable questions about my qualifications for the job. Interviewers were not highly practiced but personable and made me feel comfortable with the company. Heard back within 2 business days and started the next week.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience [relevant to the position]?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Counterpart International (Arlington, VA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the online system. I had one interview with two manager-level people who vetted me more for technical knowledge, and then a second interview with the program officers/assistants and the team director that seemed to be more about personality meshing. I heard back within a week that I had gotten the job and I started right away.
Interview Questions: Interview was focused on international development knowledge, language abilities, career aspirations - this was for an internship after all.

title: Senior Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Counterpart International (Arlington, VA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: My resume was submitted for a grant proposal. After it was accepted, I was interviewed by phone by the business development team and group manager. The process was mainly a formality. About a month later I was contacted and given hiring information. They never requested an in-person meeting before asking me to sign a commitment letter, which I thought was odd.
Interview Questions: There was nothing unexpected or difficult.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Counterpart International (Arlington, VA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: only one interview and no phone screening !!

title: Program Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Counterpart International in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview process was good. Professional and the impression the interviewers gave was positive.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Counterpart International (Arlington, VA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: 2 months long, interrupted and then re-started before finally being hired.
Interview Questions: Future direction of the firm (Strategic Vision)
